intro: Lipocarpha raynaliana, commonly known as the slender marsh sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is typically found in wetland habitats such as marshes and swampy areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments.
